{"step_by_step_thinking": "Since the person is HBsAg positive but Anti-HBc Ab negative, it suggests that they are hosting hepatitis B virus, but the immune system has not yet mounted an active response to the infection. This means the patient may be at risk of developing chronic liver disease if left untreated. Therefore, the next step should involve checking for HBV DNA load to determine the viral load and the stage of the infection.", "answer_choice": C}
